title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 342.5 - Composition of arbitration committee
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 342.5 - Composition of arbitration committee

State Regulations
(a) In accordance with subdivision (6) of
section
13-k
of the Workers' Compensation Law, a podiatry arbitration committee shall
consist of three duly recognized and licensed podiatrists who are members of a
recognized professional association representing podiatrists in the State of

New York, one to be appointed by the president of such an association, one to
be appointed by the employer or carrier and one to be appointed by the chair of
the Workers' Compensation Board. (b) The arbitrator designated by the chair of
the Workers' Compensation Board shall serve as chair of the
committee. (c) A nominee shall not
be eligible to serve as an arbitrator with relation to any bill rendered by a
podiatrist or disputed by a carrier with whom he or she is in any way
associated. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
342.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
